cause.description:
ARC is a private, not-for-profit organization that provides services to over 550 children and adults with special needs in Greenwich and Stamford, Connecticut.
Established in June 2001, the Anything's Possible Players theatre company has provided education, arts and entertainment to the Greenwich community for the past six summers. The progrm was developed to provide inclusive opportunities for teens and young adults with and without disabilities between the ages of 14 and 25. It is our hope that through theatre we encourage young people to develop friendships, express creativity, and learn the appreciate the gifts and talents of all cast members. Using theatre is an excellent, exciting, and fun way to teach valuable skills and enhance abilities. The troupe continues to grow each year from 18 performers in the year 2001 to 53 in 2006.
Anything's Possible Players is the only theatrical troupe in lower Fairfield County providing opportunities for teens and young adults, both with and without special needs. Productions include, 'You're a Good Man Charlie Brown', 'Guy's and Doll's', 'Little Shop of Horrors', 'Cinderella', 'The Wiz' and 'Grease'.
*Quoted from the Anything's Possible Players brochure.
1. promote confidence, uncover hidden talents, and encourage individual expression
2. enhance skills and appreciation of theatre arts
3. develop creativity, cultural awareness and diversity
